title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2019, ICBF has validated quality standards that are culturally appropriated to implement comprehensive care strategies for Early Child Development (ECD), that involve families and child development centres., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, girls and boys under age 5 in rural, indigenous and afro-descendant communities benefit from culturally appropriate implementation of the national strategy De Cero a Siempre and other relevant policies

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

sector.narrative: Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, ICBF has validated quality standards that are culturally appropriated to implement comprehensive care strategies for ECD,that involve families and child development centres.

description.narrative: UNICEF coordinated actions with ICBF and the Ministry of Health to enable these two institutions to have validated training modules in health and nutrition, care and parenting, care for the caregiver, and the abbreviated development scale. These training modules strengthened the capacities of more than 9,270 officials and operators of ICBF&39;s early childhood and nutrition programs, as well as health professionals who provide services and who need to strengthen child development assessment mechanisms | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021

title.narrative: Percentage of Service Units (UDS) for families prioritized by ICBF and UNICEF that implement the strategy Seres de Cuidado [Beings to Care for], according to the scheme for improving assistance quality defined by ICBF.(41814), Text

baseline.value: 1670 The UDSs are being supported by ICBF in complying with quality conditions defined by the strategy De Cero a Siempre.

title.narrative: Regionals of ICBF implementing the family mode operating manual, taking into account the departments prioritized by UNICEF.(45633), Text
